TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AmbientTheme extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerTheme

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides the look and feel property settings to a top-level workflow in a design-time environment.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Workflow themes define the look and feel of a workflow design surface. This includes any background styles, foreground styles, fonts, and icons defined for the workflow design surface. An ambient theme contains the default display properties for the workflow design surface. It provides settings to be used across the entire design surface (for example, the grid, background and foreground colors, read-only designer color, and so on). It can use either user-selected values or the values from the operational system.

Docs.param: The with which the ambient theme is associated.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using a .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient back color on a workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the ambient background color. The default is white.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you set the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.BackColor%2A> property, it negates the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.BackgroundBrush%2A> property value.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient brush used to fill graphical shapes displayed on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the background brush of the workflow on a design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.BackColor%2A> property value.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient bold font setting for the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that determines whether the text on the workflow design surface is bold.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient border width for objects that are placed onto the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: An integer that represents the border width of objects placed on the workflow design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient brush associated with commented designers on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that is associated with commented designers on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.CommentIndicatorColor%2A> property value.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color CommentIndicatorColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient color associated with commented designers on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that is associated with commented designers on the workflow design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient pen associated with commented designers on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that is associated with commented designers on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.CommentIndicatorColor%2A> property value and its width set to 1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient size settings for activity designers on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that determines the size of activity designers on the workflow design surface. The default value is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ambient theme associated with the workflow design surface draws grayscales.
Docs.value: if the ambient theme associated with the workflow draws grayscales; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ambient theme associated with the workflow design surface draws rounded shapes.
Docs.value: if the ambient theme associated with the workflow draws rounded shapes; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ambient theme associated with the workflow design surface draws shadows.
Docs.value: if the ambient theme associated with the workflow draws shadows; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient brush associated with an object that you drag onto the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A associated with an object that you drag onto the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.DropIndicatorColor%2A> property value.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color DropIndicatorColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient color associated with an object that you drags onto the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value associated with an object that you drag onto the workflow design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient pen associated with an object that you drag onto the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A associated with an object that you drag onto the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.DropIndicatorColor%2A> property value and its width set to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.BorderWidth%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient font settings for the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that represents the ambient font settings for the workflow design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string FontName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient font name for the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A string that represents the ambient font name for the workflow design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient fore color property for the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the ambient fore color for the workflow design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient foreground brush for the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the ambient foreground brush.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.ForeColor%2A> property value.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient foreground pen for the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the ambient foreground pen.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.DropIndicatorColor%2A> property value, its width set to 1, and its <xref:System.Drawing.Pen.DashStyle%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient height and width of glyphs on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the ambient height and width of glyphs on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates a common way you can access the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.GlyphSize%2A> property from a class that derives from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph> class.
This code example is part of the Workflow Monitor SDK Sample from the DatabaseService.cs file. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).

Docs.value: A value that represents the height and width of the grid to display on the workflow design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle GridStyle { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient grid style for the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the dash style for the grid. The default setting is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs additional initialization tasks for the class that are not performed by the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.UseOperatingSystemSettings%2A> returns `true`, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.Initialize%2A> sets all <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme> properties to the values defined by the operating system.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient brush settings for major grids on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A associated with the major grid on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.GridColor%2A> property value.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient pen settings for major grids on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A associated with the major grid on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.GridColor%2A> property value, its width set to 1, and its <xref:System.Drawing.Pen.DashStyle%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle.Dash>.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient margin settings for the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that represents the margin settings on the workflow design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient pen settings for minor grids on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A associated with the minor grid on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> with its color calculated based on the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.GridColor%2A> property value, its width set to 1, and its <xref:System.Drawing.Pen.DashStyle%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnAmbientPropertyChanged(valuetype System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientProperty ambientProperty) cil managed

Docs.param: The enumeration value to which the setting was changed.
Docs.summary: Notifies the when the value of the enumeration changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientProperty> specifies the source of ambient theme properties for classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerTheme> class. The two possible sources are the operating system and the designer-specified settings.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient brush used to fill graphical shapes associated with read-only items displayed on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that represents the brush associated with read-only items on the workflow on a design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush> object with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.ReadonlyIndicatorColor%2A> property value.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient color for read-only items on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the ambient color for read-only items on the workflow design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color SelectionForeColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient color for selected items on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the ambient color for read-only items on the workflow design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient foreground brush used to fill graphical shapes associated with selected items displayed on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that represents the brush associated with read-only items on the workflow on a design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush> object with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.SelectionForeColor%2A> property value.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient foreground pen settings for selected items on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A associated with the foreground of selected items on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) by default it will return a `Pen` with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.SelectionForeColor%2A> property value and its width set to 1.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Drawing.Color SelectionPatternColor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient pattern color for items that you select on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the ambient pattern color for items that you select on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.SelectionPatternPen%2A> is not null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) when you set <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.SelectionPatternColor%2A>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.SelectionPatternColor%2A> will dispose of any resources used by <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.SelectionPatternPen%2A> and set it to `null` (`Nothing`).

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient pen settings for the pattern associated with selected items on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A associated with the pattern of selected items on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), by default it will return a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> with its color set to the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.SelectionPatternColor%2A> property value, its width set to 1, and its <xref:System.Drawing.Pen.DashStyle%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient size of a selected item on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that represents the ambient property settings for selected items on the workflow design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ShowConfigErrors { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the workflow design surface displays configuration errors.
Docs.value: if the workflow design surface is to display configuration errors; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can set <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.ShowConfigErrors%2A> to false. Doing this for a workflow design surface means that none of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> objects displayed on the design surface will display their associated <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction> objects.
This code example is part of the Tracking Profile Designer SDK Sample from the WorkflowDesignerControl.cs file. For more information, see [Tracking Profile Designer Sample](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/a280199c-3000-4148-ac63-cb5aaeac07c8).
[!code-csharp[WF_Samples#125](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/cs/snippets1.cs#125)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#125](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/wf_samples/vb/snippets1.vb#125)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ShowDesignerBorder { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the workflow design surface displays designer borders.
Docs.value: if the workflow design surface displays designer borders; otherwise, . The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ShowGrid { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether grids will be shown on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: if grids will be displayed on the workflow design surface; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text quality to display on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that specifies the text quality settings to use on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.TextQuality%2A> allows you to determine whether the text displayed on a workflow design surface, and all its child designers, is anti-aliased or aliased. Anti-aliased text provides higher quality text display, while aliased text requires fewer resources to maintain.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the uses the theme settings of the operating system.
Docs.value: if the uses theme settings of the operating system; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient alignment settings for watermark images on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that specifies the ambient alignment settings for watermark images on the workflow design surface. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string WatermarkImagePath { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient path to the image to display as a watermark on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A string that contains the ambient path to the image to display as a watermark on the workflow design surface. The default is an empty string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A> to associate an image as a watermark image for a workflow design surface. If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A> is not `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) when you set <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A> disposes of any resources used by <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A> and sets its value to `null` (`Nothing`).

Docs.summary: Gets the ambient image to associate with the workflow design surface as its watermark.
Docs.value: An to use as a watermark on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A> to associate an image as a watermark image for a workflow design surface. If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A> is not `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) when you set <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A> disposes of any resources used by <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.WatermarkImagePath%2A> and sets its value to `null` (`Nothing`).
